cards.question: What problem does React solve in front-end development?
cards.answer: It keeps UIs in sync with application state by re-rendering components when data changes, avoiding manual DOM updates.

cards.question: Which React hook introduces local state inside a function component?
cards.answer: The useState hook returns a state value and an updater function so components can track small pieces of UI data.

cards.question: Name two benefits of splitting a UI into reusable components.
cards.answer: Components encourage reuse across screens and make complex interfaces easier to test, reason about, and maintain.

cards.question: What is the main goal of time-blocking your study sessions?
cards.answer: It protects focused work periods by assigning tasks to specific time slots, reducing multitasking and procrastination.

cards.question: How does spaced repetition improve long-term memory?
cards.answer: It schedules reviews right before you would forget, strengthening recall each time you revisit the material.

cards.question: List a quick tactic to regain focus when distractions appear.
cards.answer: Write the distraction on a capture list, silence notifications, and commit to returning to it after the current study block.
